body:
Before you continue with your application you should consider what the court process involves and whether you need to go.

!include:help-vulnerable-nudge!

## What happens at court

A judge will always put your children first. What you want may not be the best thing for your children. You must be prepared to accept the judge’s decision, even if you find it difficult.

The judge’s decision is legally binding. This means that you and the other person must follow the terms of the order.

[Find out more about going to court ]({app:urls:url:cait_court})

## Change or enforce an order

The court order isn’t flexible. If you disagree with any part of the order you can ask a court to change it. You can also ask a court to enforce an order if the other person isn’t following it.

You’ll need to apply to court again if you want to change or enforce an order.

## Representing yourself in court

Most people no longer qualify for free legal help. If you don’t qualify, or can’t afford a lawyer, you will need to learn [how to represent yourself in court]({app:urls:url:govuk-representing-yourself}) before you apply.
heading: Going to court
